recipes.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.description: A classic Italian pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and pepper.

steps.description: Start by boiling a large pot of salted water. Once it reaches a rolling boil, add the spaghetti and cook until it’s al dente (firm to the bite), according to the package instructions. While the pasta cooks, prepare the other ingredients so everything is ready to combine while the spaghetti is hot.

In a separate pan over medium heat, cook the pancetta until it becomes crispy and releases its fat. Stir occasionally to ensure even cooking. Once the pancetta is crisp and golden, remove the pan from heat and set it aside. The rendered fat will be used to flavor the pasta.

In a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs and grated Pecorino Romano cheese until smooth and creamy. Make sure to whisk thoroughly to avoid clumping. The mixture should have a thick consistency and a slight sheen. Add a small amount of freshly cracked black pepper to taste.

When the pasta is al dente, reserve a small cup of pasta cooking water, then drain the spaghetti. Quickly transfer the hot spaghetti to the pan with pancetta (off the heat), and toss to coat the pasta in the pancetta fat. Immediately pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta, tossing rapidly to create a creamy sauce. Add a bit of reserved pasta water as needed to achieve a smooth, silky consistency.

Serve the carbonara immediately, plating it while hot. Finish with extra grated Pecorino Romano and a sprinkling of freshly cracked black pepper for an extra kick. Enjoy your delicious homemade Spaghetti Carbonara!

recipes.title: Chicken Curry
recipes.description: A flavorful and spicy chicken curry made with a blend of spices and coconut milk.

steps.description: Start by heating oil in a pot over medium heat. Add finely chopped onions and cook until they become golden brown and soft, stirring occasionally to avoid burning.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the pot, followed by the spice mix. Stir well to coat the onions in the spices and cook until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
Add the chicken pieces to the pot and cook, stirring frequently, until they are browned on all sides. This should take around 5-7 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk, stirring well to combine with the chicken and spices. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook until the chicken is fully cooked through and tender, approximately 15-20 minutes.
Serve the curry hot with steamed rice, and garnish with freshly chopped cilantro for added flavor.

recipes.title: Beef Stroganoff
recipes.description: A creamy Russian dish made with beef, mushrooms, and sour cream.

steps.description: Sauté onions and mushrooms in butter until softened.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Stir in sour cream and let it simmer.
Serve over egg noodles or rice.

recipes.title: Vegetable Stir Fry
recipes.description: A quick and healthy stir fry made with a variety of fresh vegetables.

steps.description: Heat oil in a wok and add vegetables.
Add sauce and cook for another minute.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.
